New Records: Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion
Key Match Events: India were ALL OUT in 138 runs in just 26.1 overs
Sri Lanka posted a total of 248 off 7 wickets in 50 overs
Kusal Mendis (59) and Pathum Nissanka (45) contributed with their bat
Mohammed Siraj, Axar Patel, Washington Sundar and Kuldeep Yadav clinched one wicket each
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma's men are looking to avoid losing the series
Questions are also being asked about Virat Kohli, who has scored just 38 runs in the two matches so far
Riyan Parag makes his international debut, primarily as a bowler
The surface in Colombo favouring the slower bowlers
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka said at post presentation, 'The team did all things right throughout the series. We all knew they are a strong batting line up and we wanted to back our strength, spin was our strength and we backed it.'
Rohit Sharma said at post presentation, 'I don't think it is a concern. But it is something we have to look at indivdually and as a game plan.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India lost 27 wickets to spin is the most by any team in a bilateral ODI series
Sri Lanka has their 6 players injured and could not play in the series
Sri Lanka won the ODI series by 2-0, as the first match resulted in a tie
